General course objectives:
General course objectives
To introduce the student to applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence with the aim of understanding and designing materials at the atomic level.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
make basic object-oriented programs in Python
understand the probabilistic basis for machine learning
apply machine-learning methods like kernel regression, Gaussian processes, and neural networks
understand the concept of fingerprints in machine learning
know existing computational libraries in Python for machine learning
understand the meaning of atomic and electronic descriptors in materials design
use publicly available databases with computed material properties
make simple screenings of databases to identify materials with specific properties
carry through a project with identification of materials with specific properties by use of machine learning and artificial intelligence
Content: Elementary object-oriented programming in Python. Probability theory and Bayes' theorem. Machine learning methods: linear basis function models, kernel regression, Gaussian processes, and neural networks. Estimation of hyperparameters. Python libraries for machine learning and artificial intelligence. Fingerprints. Calculation of descriptors for materials properties. Web-based databases of material properties. Database search for particular materials properties. Application of machine learning and artificial intelligence to materials screening.
